articleContent.title: Chord: Minor b6th in E (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Minor b6th in E (Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
The Minor b6th chord in E, using the D shape on the guitar, is a unique and colorful chord that adds a sense of tension and melancholy to your music. This chord consists of the notes E, G, Bb, and C. It is a rich and emotional chord that can add depth and complexity to your chord progressions.

## Notes and Intervals
- E (Root)
- G (Minor 3rd)
- Bb (Diminished 5th)
- C (Diminished 6th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor b6th chord is often used in jazz, blues, and alternative music genres. It has a mysterious and moody quality that can evoke feelings of introspection and melancholy. This chord can add a touch of dissonance and tension to your music, creating a sense of depth and complexity.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the Minor b6th chord in E (Shape: D):
1. "Strange" by Celeste
2. "Tears in Heaven" by Eric Clapton
3. "A Whiter Shade of Pale" by Procol Harum
